channel.title: World Wide Webber
channel.description: Recent content on World Wide Webber

item.title: Bi-gram cardinality estimation in a graph database
Database system with transactional commit protocol based on safe conjunction of majorities
Pre-emptive graph search for guided natural language interactions with connected data systems
Graph database system to safely store data at high volume and scale
A Performance Study of Epoch-based Commit Protocols in Distributed OLTP Databases
item.description: Distributed OLTP systems execute the high- overhead, two-phase commit (2PC) protocol at the end of every distributed transaction. Epoch-based commit proposes that 2PC be executed only once for all transactions processed within a time interval called an epoch. Increasing epoch duration allows more transactions to be processed before the common 2PC. It thus reduces 2PC overhead per transaction, increases throughput but also increases average transaction latency. Therefore, required is the ability to choose the right epoch size that offers the desired trade-off between throughput and latency. To this end, we develop two analytical models to estimate throughput and average latency in terms of epoch size taking into account load and failure conditions. Simulations affirm their accuracy and effectiveness. We then present epoch-based multi-commit which, unlike epoch- based commit, seeks to avoid all transactions being aborted when failures occur, and also performs identically when failures do not occur. Our performance study identifies workload factors that make it more effective in preventing transaction aborts and concludes that the analytical models can be equally useful in predicting its performance as well.

item.title: Pick & Mix Isolation Levels: Mixed Serialization Graph Testing
Keynote Speech
item.description: A tour of the building blocks of Neo4j that make it super-performant for graph storage, query, and compute.

item.title: Knowledge Graphs
item.description: A short introduction to Knowledge Graphs for CIOs, CDOs, and data managers.

item.title: Strong Consitency Claims in Distributed Graph Databases
item.description: Thoughts on the design of distributed graph databases that use strongly consistent methods for the data stored on their shards, but pay no regard to ordering of concurrent updates.

item.title: The Coming of Age of Graph Databases
item.description: A short introduction to Neo4j and Cypher from the viewpoint of someone who has been with the technology for a long time.

item.title: Zappi Installation
item.description: Things learned installing a Zappi home EV charging socket.

item.title: Site Upgrade
item.description: I’ve just upgraded to the new modular Hugo static site builder and have taken the opportunity to smarten up a few things on my site. In the meantime I’m slowly migrating over some content like my publication record.

item.title: Modeling the Gradual Degradation of Eventually-Consistent Distributed Graph Databases
item.description: Eventually consistent distribted graph databases corrupt data. This paper shows the rate at corruption leading to abandomment of a database and provides calibrated tools for reasoning about the spread of corruption in production databases.

item.title: Graph Databases for Dummies
item.description: A practice and humane introduction to graph databases and Neo4j, Graph Databases For Dummies walks you through modeling, querying, and importing graph data, all the way through to your first production system.

item.title: Preserving reciprocal consistency in distributed graph databases
item.description: Reciprocal consistency is at the heart of dependable distributed graph databases. This work examines methods for preserving reciprocal consistency and thus data correctness.

item.title: Design and Evalution of an Edge-based Concurrency Protocol for Distributed Graph Databases
item.description: A novel concurrency control mechanism for distributed graph databases that aborts any transaction that could introduce inconsistencies, along with peformance evaluation

item.title: Method and apparatus for ensuring consistent outcomes in updates to distributed databases
ACTiCLOUD: Enabling the Next Generation of Cloud Applications
item.description: An overview of the ACTiCLOUD project for adaptable, data-intensive cloud workloads.

item.title: Graph database devices and methods for partitioning graphs
Investigations on path indexing for graph databases
item.description: Results of an investigation into path indexing for graph databases.

item.title: Graph Databases
item.description: The first book on graph databases, now in its second edition. Provides in-depth coverage of graph modeling and querying, as well as thorough explanations of the internal workings of Neo4j.

item.title: Starting Graph Databases with Neo4j 2.0
item.description: An article on starting out with graphs and Neo4j 2.0, with a focus on the Cypher query language.

item.title: A programmatic introduction to Neo4j
item.description: A tutorial for learning to program with Neo4j’s graph model.

item.title: Towards a Horizontally Scalable Graph Database
item.description: Prelimary work on support for supporting very large data sets in graph databases.

item.title: Exterminate! Your Database Woes with Neo4j
item.description: How to build a graph model in Neo4j, with examples from the long history of Doctor Who!

item.title: Rest in Practice
The Role of Hypermedia in Distributed System Development
item.description: Demonstrating practical RESTful business protocols with framework support from Restfulie.

item.title: SSDL - The SOAP Service Description Language
item.description: Simplifying Web Services interfaces in the general case, and making it possible to perform model checks on multi-party protocols.

item.title: Soya: a Programming Model and Runtime Environment for Component Composition using SSDL
item.description: An implementation of SSDL tooling and an empirical demonstration of how developers can readily use SSDL to build robust services and systems of services.

item.title: Expressing and Reasoning about Service Contracts in Service-Oriented Computing
item.description: Using SSDL to reason about message exchange patterns (or business protocols) between autonomous services.

item.title: Secure and Provable Service Support for Human-Intensive Real-Estate Processes
item.description: A realistic workflow appliation for real-estate using SSDL to reason about correctness of multiparty protocols over the Internet.

item.title: An Architect’s Guide to Developing Enterprise Web Services
item.description: A companion update to the Developing Enterprise Web Services book after two years additional standards work.

item.title: Asynchronous messaging between Web services using SSDL
item.description: An overview of the SOAP Service Description Language (SSDL) and its support for multi-party end-to-end business protocols.

item.title: First International Workshop on Design of Service-Oriented Applications (WDSOA'05)
item.description: Organising and editing the proceedings of a workshop on the design of service-oriented systems alongside ICSOC 2005.

item.title: Service-oriented, Distributed, High-Performance Computing
item.description: An article on High Performance Computing (HPC) Grids built with SOA.

item.title: Web Service Grids: An Evolutionary Approach
item.description: A roadmap for protocol standardisation to ease the adoption of e-science and grid computing technology.

item.title: WS‐GAF: a framework for building Grid applications using Web Services
item.description: A mapping of requirements for global scale grid computing onto standard Web Services protocols.

item.title: Assessing the Risk and Value of Adopting Emerging and Unstable Web Services Specifications
item.description: A framework for reasoning about an immature and chaotic set of protocols and standards for building potentially long-lived systems.

item.title: Grid Computing using Web Services Technologies
item.description: Showing how large-scale Grid computing designed as a service-oriented architecture and implemented by standard Web Services.

item.title: The WS-GAF Registry Service
item.description: The WS-GAF Registry Service is a naming and metadata service which allows clients to late bind (in a limited fashion) to services as part of a larger grid application.

item.title: Stateful Interactions in Web Services: A Comparison of WS-Context and WS-ResourceFramework
item.description: An article how two competing/overlapping protocols each support the notion of conversational state in a system of Web Services.

item.title: Why WSDL is not Yet Another Object IDL
item.description: An article about how WSDL should be considered a contract language for message exchanges, rather than an IDL for object interactions.

item.title: Horses for Courses: Services, Objects, and Loose Coupling
item.description: An article on the differences between loose coupling in object-oriented and service-oriented systems, and how treating services like remote objects leads to tight coupling.

item.title: Introducting WS-CAF
item.description: An overview of the three-layered WS-CAF framework for distributed context, coordination, and transactions.

item.title: Developing Enterprise Web Services
Demystifying Service Oriented Architectures
item.description: An article on designing services in a Service-Oriented Architecture.

item.title: OASIS Web Services Composite Application Framework (WS-CAF)
Introducing BPEL4WS
item.description: The final article in a series of articles on safely executing complex business protocols over Web Services. This focuses on business processes supported by transactional Web Services.

item.title: Introducting WS-Transaction
item.description: The second and third in a series of articles on safely executing complex business protocols over Web Services. This focuses on atomic transactions and business activities layered atop WS-Coordination.

item.title: Introducting WS-Coordination
item.description: The first in a series of articles on safely executing complex business protocols over Web Services. This focuses on coordination as a general mechanism.

item.title: Coordinating Business Transactions on the Web
item.description: An overview of the OASIS Business Transactions Protocol for reaching agreement on the Internet.

item.title: Building Transactional Web Services with OASIS BTP
item.description: A two-part article on building and composing transactional Web Services.

item.title: The Misplaced Comma: Programmers’ Tales and Traditions
item.description: Thinking about how programmers interact, the stories they tell, and how they impact software engineering.

item.title: The Smart Money's on OASIS BTP
item.description: A guest editorial on using OASIS BTP execute transactions between Web Services.

item.title: Making Web Services Work
item.description: Magazine article on using OASIS BTP to enable transactions between Web Services.

item.title: Visual, Object-Oriented Development of Parallel Applications
item.description: A visual, object-oriented parallel programming language for non-specialists.

item.title: Visual Object-Oriented Development of Parallel Applications
item.description: My Ph.D. thesis on visual programming for high peformance computing.

item.title: Visual, Object-Oriented Development of Parallel Applications
item.description: The Vorlon hybrid textual-visual parallel programming language.

item.title: Gotos Considered Harmful and Other Programmers' Taboos
item.description: Thinking about programmers’ susperstitions and taboos and the effects they have on software development.
